titleStmt.author: S., E.

publicationStmt.publisher: To the Reader: The English Preface in Print, c. 1475-1640 / Early English Books Online Text Creation Partnership

analytic.title: To the right honourable the Lord of Hunsdon, high Chamber laine to her Maiesty.

monogr.title: The faerie queene : Disposed into twelue books, fashioning XII. morall vertues
monogr.author: Spenser, Edmund

div.head: To the right honourable the Lord of Hunsdon, high Chamber laine to her Maiesty.
div.l: REnowmed Lord, that for your worthinesse
And noble deeds haue your deserued place,
High in the fauour of that Emperesse.
The worlds sole glory and her sexes grace,
Here eke of right haue you a worthie place,
Both for your nearnes to that Faerie Queene,
And for your owne high merit in like cace,
Of which, apparaunt proofe was to be seene,
When that tumultuous rage and fearfull deene
Of Northerne rebels ye did pacify,
And their distoiall powre defaced clene,
Liue Lord for euer in this lasting verse,
That all posteritie thy honor may reherse.
